name: Inventory
description: The `Inventory` class is a fundamental component in JSMacros that provides comprehensive interaction with Minecraft inventory systems. It represents any open inventory interface, including player inventory, containers, crafting stations, and special GUIs. The Inventory class enables automated item management, slot manipulation, and inventory operations through a unified API.
overview:
The `Inventory` class serves as the base class for all inventory interactions in JSMacros and provides:

- Universal inventory slot access and manipulation
- Item searching and filtering capabilities
- Automated clicking, dragging, and moving operations
- Support for all vanilla Minecraft inventory types
- Chain-able methods for complex inventory operations
- Integration with Minecraft's native inventory handling

constructors.description: Creates a new Inventory instance from a HandledScreen.

parameters.name: inventory
parameters.description: The screen handler to create inventory from

methods.name: create
methods.description: Creates a new Inventory instance for the currently open screen.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description: Retrieves a set of unique ItemStackHelper objects representing all items currently present in the inventory.
examples:
const allItems = inventory.getItems();
Chat.log(`Inventory contains ${allItems.size()} different items`);

methods.name: findItem
methods.description: Finds all slots containing a specific item by its ID.

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description: The ID of the item to search for (e.g., 'minecraft:oak_planks').

methods.name: swapHotbar
methods.description: Swaps an item from a source slot to a hotbar slot, or to another general slot.

parameters.name: sourceSlot
parameters.description: The index of the slot to move the item from.

parameters.name: targetHotbarIndex
parameters.description: The target hotbar index (0-8) or general slot index to move the item to.

methods.name: findFreeSlot
methods.description: Finds the index of the first empty slot within a specified inventory section.

methods.name: getItemCount
methods.description: Returns an object mapping item IDs to their total counts across the inventory.

methods.name: quick
methods.description: Performs a quick-move (shift-click) operation on the specified slot, moving the item to an appropriate location.

parameters.name: slotIndex
parameters.description: The index of the slot to quick-move.

examples:
inventory.quick(slots[i]);
            Time.sleep(50); // Small delay for server sync

methods.name: is
methods.description: Checks if the current inventory's type matches any of the provided type names.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: One or more inventory type names to check against (e.g., 'Furnace', 'Creative Inventory').

methods.name: getSlots
methods.description: Retrieves an array of slot indices belonging to a specified inventory section.
examples:
const containerSlots = inventory.getSlots("container");
    const hotbarSlots = inventory.getSlots("hotbar");

const inputSlots = inventory.getSlots("input");
    const outputSlot = inventory.getSlots("output")[0];

methods.name: getSlot
methods.description: Retrieves an ItemStackHelper object representing the item in the specified slot.

parameters.name: slotIndex
parameters.description: The index of the slot to retrieve.

methods.name: getSelectedHotbarSlotIndex
methods.description: Gets the index of the currently selected hotbar slot.

methods.name: getType
methods.description: Returns the string identifier for the type of the current open inventory (e.g., 'Player Inventory', 'Furnace').
